used to triggered keyboard-related operations, e.g. when
tapping a button, or when certain events happen. You can

abstract.text: This enum defines keyboard-specific actions, and is also
a namespace for keyboard action-related types.
Whether or not the action is a shift action.
A diacritic action, that will replace any previous match when release.
Moves the input cursor forward one step when released.
Whether or not the action is a character margin.
An
shorthand.
A list of URL domain-related actions.
Whether or not the action is a keyboard type action.
An
shorthand.
An
shorthand.
Represents a dictation key.
Open an url when released, using a custom id for identification.
This is a typealias for a keyboard action array.
The standard layout item insets.
Inserts a text character when released, rendered as empty space.
The action’s accessibility label.
The standard button border style.
Inserts a text string when released.
Whether or not the action is a character action.
The standard layout item size.
Whether the action should re-insert autocomplete inserted spaces.
The standard button style corner radius.
The standard button image.
Represents a settings (⚙️) key.
Changes the keyboard type when pressed.
The standard keyboard button style foreground color.
The standard layout item width.
Inserts a tab when released.
Whether or not the action is an emoji action.
The standard controller action for a certain gesture.
The standard controller action.
The standard keyboard font.
KeyboardKit helps you create fully customizable keyboard extensions, using Swift and SwiftUI.
Whether or not the action is a primary action.
Represents a function (fn) key.
The standard press action, if any.
Deletes backwards when pressed, and repeats until released.
Whether an action has a standard text.
Represents a command (⌘) key.
Changes keyboard case when released and double tapped.
The standard keyboard font weight.
Inserts a period or a URL domain.
The theme button type.
The standard repeat action, if any.
A character margin action can add an extra tap area.
Dismisses the keyboard when released.
This class provides a standard way to handle actions
that are triggered by the keyboard.
A placeholder action that does nothing and should be rendered as empty space.
Whether an action has a standard image.
This typealias defines a controller gesture action.
Whether the action should apply autocorrect suggestions.
Moves the input cursor back one step when released.
The standard keyboard button background color in its
raw form, without any opacity applied.
The standard button style.
The standard double tap action, if any.
Can be used to refer to an image asset.
Whether the action should remove autocomplete inserted spaces.
The standard keyboard button background opacity.
This protocol is an alias for other protocols that model
types in the framework should conform to.
Triggers the system keyboard switcher on release and long press.
Represents an option (⌥) key.
Inserts an emoji when released.
The standard button shadow style.
Whether or not the action is an alphabetic type.
The standard button image scale.
A primary key, e.g.
etc. that inserts a new line on release.
This enum defines keyboard-specific actions, and is also
a namespace for keyboard action-related types.
The standard button text.
The standard button layout configuration.
The standard long press action, if any.
The standard keyboard font size.
Whether or not the action is a character margin.
The input callout text to present for the action.
Whether or not the action is a dark system action.
A custom action that you can handle in any custom way.
Whether or not the action is an input action.
Can be used to refer to a system image (SF Symbol).
Triggers a locale switcher action on release and menu on long press.
Switch to a caps-lock keyboard when pressed.
The standard layout item insets.
This protocol can be implemented by any classes that can
handle triggered
events.
Inserts a space when released and can perform custom actions when long pressed.
Inserts a text character when released.
Open system settings for the app when released.

The standard release action, if any.

Represents a control (⌃) key.
